questions.explanation: Git branches allow developers to work on different features or fixes independently without affecting the main codebase. This is especially useful when working on multiple features simultaneously.
options: A) To track changes made to a file
B) To create a separate line of development for features or fixes
C) To backup your code repository
D) To collaborate with team members
questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a Git branch?

questions.explanation: The 'git add' command is used to stage changes, preparing them for a future commit. This command updates the index with the specified files or directories.
questions.question: The command _____ is used to stage changes in a Git repository.

questions.explanation: Git is designed to be used on a single machine, but it can also be used in a distributed manner. This means that multiple developers can collaborate by sharing their local repositories with each other.
questions.question: Git is a distributed version control system.

questions.explanation: The 'git log' command displays the commit history of a Git repository, showing the commits in chronological order. This can be useful for tracking changes over time or identifying specific commits.
options: A) Show the commit history of a repository
B) Create a new branch from an existing one
questions.question: What does the 'git log' command do?

questions.explanation: When working with multiple branches, Git merge is used to combine the changes made in those branches into a single branch. This process can help resolve conflicts between different branches.
options: A) To resolve conflicts between different branches
B) To create a new branch from an existing one
C) To revert a previous commit
questions.question: What is the purpose of a Git merge?

results.explanation: Git branches allow developers to work on different features or fixes independently without affecting the main codebase. This is especially useful when working on multiple features simultaneously.
The 'git add' command is used to stage changes, preparing them for a future commit. This command updates the index with the specified files or directories.

Git is designed to be used on a single machine, but it can also be used in a distributed manner. This means that multiple developers can collaborate by sharing their local repositories with each other.
The 'git log' command displays the commit history of a Git repository, showing the commits in chronological order. This can be useful for tracking changes over time or identifying specific commits.
When working with multiple branches, Git merge is used to combine the changes made in those branches into a single branch. This process can help resolve conflicts between different branches.
